property.name: hide_children
property.help: Hides all of the sizer's children.

property.name: disabled
property.help: Disable all of the sizer's children.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Hides the sizer and it's children.

property.name: hide_children
property.help: Hides all of the sizer's children.

option.name: wxALIGN_RIGHT
option.help: Aligns the checkbox to the right of the text instead of the left.

property.name: tooltip
property.help: Attach a tooltip to the checkbox label.

property.name: disabled
property.help: Disable all of the sizer's children, but not the checkbox label.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Hides the sizer and it's children.

event.name: wxEVT_CHECKBOX
event.help: Generated when the checkbox is clicked.

property.name: tooltip
property.help: Attach a tooltip to the radio button label.

property.name: disabled
property.help: Disable all of the sizer's children, but not the radio button label.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Hides the sizer and it's children.

event.name: wxEVT_RADIOBUTTON
event.help: Generated when the radio button is clicked.

property.name: hide_children
property.help: Hides all of the sizer's children.

property.name: rows
property.help: Number of Rows. If '0', wxWidgets will automatically calculate the number of rows required to hold the supplied items.

property.name: cols
property.help: Number of Columns. If row is not zero, cols can be set to '0' to have wxWidgets automtaically calculate the number of columns required.

property.name: vgap
property.help: The vertical gap (in pixels) between the cells in the sizer.

property.name: hgap
property.help: The horizontal gap (in pixels) between cells in the sizer.

property.name: hide_children
property.help: Hides all of the sizer's children.

property.name: rows
property.help: Number of Rows. '0' tells wxWidgets to calculate the number of rows required to hold the supplied items. If you choose to fix the row number, set the 'cols' figure to zero instead.

property.name: cols
property.help: Number of Columns

property.name: hide_children
property.help: Hides all of the sizer's children.

property.name: empty_cell_size
property.help: The size used for cells in the grid with no item.

property.name: hide_children
property.help: Hides all of the sizer's children.

property.name: text
property.help: Splits text up at newlines and places the lines into wxStaticText objects with the specified maximum width in a vertical wxBoxSizer.

property.name: width
property.help: Specifies the text's maximum width.

property.name: width
property.help: The width of the spacer. Ignored if proportion is non-zero or the sizer is aligned vertically.

property.name: height
property.help: The height of the spacer. Ignored if proportion is non-zero or the sizer is aligned horizontally.

property.name: add_default_border
property.help: If checked, 5 is added to the spacer size on normal displays, and on Windows, 10 is added on a high DPI display. Ignored if strech is non-zero.

property.name: proportion
property.help: If non-zero, the spacer is stretched in proportion to the other controls in the sizer.

property.name: OK
property.help: Create a 'OK' button. Cannot be combined with Yes or Save buttons.

property.name: Yes
property.help: Create a 'Yes' button. Cannot be combined with OK or Save buttons.

property.name: Save
property.help: Create a 'Save' button. Cannot be combined with OK or Yes buttons.

property.name: Apply
property.help: Create a 'Apply' button

property.name: No
property.help: Create a 'No' button

property.name: Cancel
property.help: Create a 'Cancel' button. Cannot be combined with Close button.

property.name: Close
property.help: Create a 'Close' button. Cannot be combined with Cancel button.

property.name: Help
property.help: Create a 'Help' button.

property.name: ContextHelp
property.help: Create a 'ContextHelp' button.

property.name: default_button
property.help: The default button

property.name: static_line
property.help: Creates a sizer with standard buttons separated from the rest of the dialog contents by a horizontal wxStaticLine. It will add a separating static line only if it conforms to the current platform convention (currently it is not added under Mac where the use of static lines for grouping is discouraged and is added elsewhere). This can only be used in a dialog.

event.name: OKButtonClicked
event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the OK button is clicked

event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Yes button is clicked

event.help: Process a wxEVT_BUTTON event when the Close button is clicked
